summary: The LEOSA Reform Act of 2025 aims to improve the Law Enforcement Officer Safety Act (LEOSA). The bill amends Title 18 of the United States Code to address the carrying of concealed weapons by law enforcement officers, including retired officers. Key changes include clarifying qualifications for carrying concealed firearms, modifying restrictions on where officers can carry, and permitting qualified officers to carry in certain federal facilities. The bill's intent is to update and clarify regulations surrounding law enforcement officer firearm carry.
